reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were traveling with our dog and this was the only hotel we could find that had a room that would allow dogs. There are not may hotels in Estes Park, CO. You have to book far in advance in the summertime or they have a 2-3 night min. stay. This hotel is over priced ($120.62 a night with tax) but your paying for the location. It is ok place to stay if your just staying one night and are not spending much time in the hotel. The beds are worn and we could feel the springs when we layed down on them. The carpet needed to be cleaned. The hotel was very busy but we didn't hear any noise. It is in a quite section of Estes Park and there are mountain views to the west. There is a dog park in Estes Park with lake access. Our dog got to play with other dogs before we went to Rocky Mountain National Park.
reviews.title: Old but trying to make updates.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sure, Estes Park is close to the Rocky Mountain NP, so the location of this motel is great...But there are plenty of places to stays at in Estes Park so choose an other than this place...Its pricy but not worth the money! Bed is uncomfy, and the service is just average. I bet you can get better for the same price...We wanted to wash some stuff while being there, but they don't provide soap, not even for sale...Which obviously is very unconvinent because who wants to buy a big packet of laundry cleaner and drag along that for one wash on a trip...Also, it was very loudly in the corridor during our stay so we woke up really early because you can here it all through the walls. The breakfast is ok though, cannot complain about that.
reviews.title: Don't stay unless you need to

reviews.text: This hotel looks like it hasn't moved on since the 70's. Everything is old and outdated. If you're planning on a one nighter it should be ok as long as you don't pay more thn $60 (Hotwire). Otherwise (especially if with a significant other) splurge and stay elsewhere.
reviews.title: Stay somewhere else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very lucky to find a room here, on a holiday weekend, with no reservation! The service was top-notch! The room was very clean! And the view from the balcony was spectacular! Only complaint was the water pressure in the bathroom sink, was very, very low. The shower was fine, though. I would definitely stay there again!
reviews.title: Very nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I went to the Roadway Inn with some friends and family for their annual Valentines day dinner and stay. They made every thing fun and romantic. The service was great, the dinner was great and we plan on making this part of our yearly Valentines day ritual.
reviews.title: fabulous

reviews.text: I have stayed at various Choice Hotels such as Comfort Suites and Comfort Inn; this Rodeway Inn should NOT and IS NOT a "Choice" Hotel. This place is a maze, rundown, had broken ceiling tiles everywhere, smelt like a funeral home, had oddly shaped rooms, a broken wall switch, poorly designed air conditioning unit (the room smelt worse when used), musty smelling curtains, older beds (could really feel the springs), lumpy pillows, no water pressure in the shower, very low ceilings, and many other little things that just add up to make this place and uncomfortable stay. It's simply out of date. It should be torn down and rebuilt into something better. It wasn't worth the 200$ a night for a 2 queen bedroom. Positives: the ice machine was quiet (it was right next to the room but over the noise of the air condition we couldn't really tell if was on or working) and nice looking lobby.
reviews.title: Not worth it... stay somewhere else!
Our trip was most enjoyable and had everything we wanted at the hotel.
reviews.text: We were there specifically for the 4th celebration and wasn't disappointed. The staff worked very hard to make our trip wonderful. On the day of the 4th, even though it had been raining considerably, the staff went all out to make sure we could view the fireworks as comfortably as possible. Our teenagers were well occupied with the many emenities the hotel offered, such as large pool, game room, + lots of open area to roam.

For the second year, Team USA Basketball took up residence at the Rodeway Inn in this beautiful mountain city nestled among the snow-capped Rockies. What another wonderful experience! Lil and her staff were awesome creating a relaxing environment for my players to enjoy the sites, relax in the pool and hot tub, and even get a little competitive on the pool and ping pong tables. The town shuttle took our team throughout Estes Park and the Rodeway staff was extremely helpful in explaining the sights and sounds of Estes. Susie and her husband gave us hints on which trails and roads were best at driving into Rocky Mountain National Park. What great hosts they were! They even opened a spare meeting room for my players to leave their bags after check-out time. You will not find a better location, better price, better accomodations, and the most charming town in America. Top this off with a caring and supportive management like Lil, Susie, and her husband and you will never want to leave. Last year, Team USA won the Colorado Basketball Tournament. This year, Team USA won the championship again. We are sure that, thanks to Rodeway Inn, three will be a charm next year!!! Thanks Lil and Rodeway. The "tradition of excellence" continues!!!
reviews.title: Team USA basketball wins again with Rodeway Inn Estes Park!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We selected this hotel because we were traveling with two smaller dogs. We stayed in La Quinta properties for the other 8 nights of our trip and this was really the only reasonable option for us in Estes Park. We tried another hotel that told us they did not have any pet friendly rooms available for our date and asked that we check back in a few weeks (I asked what was going to change and got no response) While I appreciate the hotel for allowing pets, they need to spend some capital on room and facility renovations and not landscaping as it appeared they were doing. There were ceiling tiles falling out, the exterior entrance to the room did not work and the toilet tank was leaking water because the ball float was out of adjustment (I fixed it myself) Furnishings were very outdated. The grounds were unkempt and unfortunately other pet owners did not clean up the droppings. The AC unit was extremely noisy. Could not wait to get out of there. If we visit the area again, we will try for another place in Estes or opt to stay in nearby city.
reviews.title: Old and tired. Needs repair and remodel

reviews.text: Even though it's a little older and further away from downtown, this is a nice hotel. Great value. They offered us buy one night get one half off. It looks like several hotel upgrades had taken place. The lobby was being painted. We had a room with a balcony and view of the lake. We watched deer right outside the balcony crossing the street. There is no elevator. The room was fine with two queen beds, tv and dvd, wireless internet access, microwave, fridge, coffee pot, and hair dryer all in the room. The first night we did experience another room nearby with a smoke detecter chirping in need of new batteries. It was quickly replaced and fixed prior to our second night. The indoor pool and jacuzzi is nice compared to other hotels in the area with outdoor pools. The water was heated but it was still a little cool. Still the kids enjoyed it all. There was also a game room with air hockey, pool tables, foosball, and video games-needed a race car video game though. I think a bar would be a nice feature at the hotel either in the game room or breakfast area. The continental breakfast was good. There was make your own waffles with batter, bagels, toast, cereal, oatmeal, and pastry choices. Orange juice, milk, and coffee. I would have liked to see fruit too, bananas or something. Overall it is a great clean hotel with nice amenities.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - all you need

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great time. We enjoyed the game room, the staff was great. The indoor swimming pool and hot tub was awesome. The breakfast was wonderful. We enjoyed the falt screen and the dvd rentals. I would recommend this clean, fun and relaxing place to anyone wanting to to stay in a affordable and spacious getaway hotel......... happy traveling from us to you all!
reviews.title: Wonderful time

reviews.text: We had the best time ever, the rooms are big and cozy and the kids enjoyed the pool and game room. We ONLY stay here we love it :) We love the staff!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: We had the best time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my husband and i went up for valentines day and had a wonderful time. the rooms where really clean the staff was awesome! the breakfast was fantastic. the hotel had a family feel to it. we would stay again for sure. loved the pool & hot tub.
reviews.title: valentines day 2010

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we stayed in was in disrepair - broken sink with loose caulk, very uncomfortable beds, broken furniture. Housekeeping couldn't even finish the job of making the beds, didn't sweep the carpet, or replace coffee supplies or kleenix. Front door creaked like it was 100 years old.
reviews.title: Bad housekeeping and old rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was just what was advertised - nothing more (no fresh fruit or hard-boiled eggs, which are sometimes offered). Hot tub was filled with dirty foam.
reviews.title: Older nice hotel and trying to be better
Good base for RMNP
reviews.text: We are budget travelers and spend very little time in our hotel. We stayed here for three nights as a base to explore Rocky Mtn Natl Park. It was great for us! We paid extra for the "nice room"--which is way more than we usually pay. So we had a dvd player (didn't use) and a microwave (used a lot). It was roomy. Breakfast was nice--waffles can be made--nice change from all the continental breakfasts we had. I will say the staff, while polite, is not all that great. When we checked in, the phone reservation I made for one room was made for two rooms in the computer, but the lady fixed it right away with no problem. For the next two nights we had trouble with the electronic keys. On night #2, neither key worked. So I went to the front desk and waited behind two other parties. No clerk came (it was approx 9pm and I was very tired). Finally, I used the desk phone to call someone up, which is fairly ridiculous to have to do. The next night, more key trouble but at least one of them worked. The key thing was quite aggravating. The hotel itself seemed nice enough otherwise and we were glad we sprung for the nice room.

Stayed here on Aug 9 in room 110 with my 70yr old mother. The rom was not clean. The floor had trash and un-vacuummed particals of debris up against the bedframe at the floor, the air conditioner smelled of mildew and the lavatory in the bathroom had a large rusted out hole that was just disgusting. When I woke up in the moring, I found bugs in the bed with me. Not bedbugs, but what looked like baby roaches. We loved Estes Park but stayed in another motel/holtel the following night to avoid the mess and the creepy-feeling uncomforatable room.
reviews.title: Do not stay here unless you have to...

reviews.text: The hotel is very old, very tired and room 236 had bedbugs. Two weeks later, the bites I got in bed that night still itch. I reported the bedbugs to the front desk, and they cheerfully said, "OK, thanks!" Not - "I'm sorry." Not - "Wow, we'll call the exterminator immediately." Not - "Gosh, can we refund you a piece of your night's stay?" Nope. I would look for anywhere else to stay in Estes Park - this hotel, despite its friendly front desk folks, is too old and buggy for comfort.
reviews.title: Bedbugs!!!!!!

reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed at the Rodeway Inn on July 8th & July 11th, prior to doing some hiking in RMNP. The Rodeway Inn was adequate, but not very nice. It fit what we were looking for (2 beds and some sleep), but the hotel was not one that I would recommend to anyone looking for anything other than that.
reviews.title: Love Estes Park

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Rodeway Inn due to the low advertised rates. Although an older hotel, the room was very clean and comfortable. I mainly wanted to comment on the most friendly and cooperative front desk staffs I had seen in a long time. Breakfast was excellent. Our new home in Estes Park is the Rodeway Inn.
reviews.title: Had a wonderful stay
